definitions: having a tail or appendage at the rear end
followed or pursued from behind by someone or something
examples: The long-tailed cat climbed up the tree
A white-tailed deer appeared in the clearing
The suspect was tailed by detectives all day
She felt tailed by her past mistakes

definitions: lacking a tail or similar rear appendage that is normally present
examples: The tailless Manx cat sat on the windowsill
Tailless amphibians evolved different locomotion methods

definitions: made to fit precisely according to individual measurements
specially designed or adapted for a particular purpose or person
examples: She wore a perfectly tailored suit to the interview
His tailored shirts always fit him impeccably
The company offers tailored solutions for each client
A tailored curriculum meets individual student needs

definitions: contaminated with something harmful or undesirable
affected by something morally bad or dishonest that damages reputation
examples: The tainted water supply made many people sick
Tainted food products were recalled immediately
His tainted reputation prevented him from getting hired
The scandal left the organization's image deeply tainted

definitions: already occupied, possessed, or claimed by someone
already in a romantic relationship with someone else
captured, seized, or removed from a place or position
examples: All the good seats were already taken
That parking spot is taken by another car
She's beautiful but unfortunately she's taken
He discovered his crush was already taken
The prisoners were taken to a secure facility
Several hostages were taken during the robbery

definitions: prepared for consumption away from the place of purchase or preparation
examples: We ordered takeout Chinese food for dinner
The takeout menu has limited options available

definitions: attractive, charming, or captivating in a way that draws attention
examples: She had a taking smile that lit up the room
His taking personality won everyone over immediately

definitions: possessing natural aptitude or skill in a particular area or activity
examples: The talented musician performed at Carnegie Hall
She's a talented artist with many gallery exhibitions

definitions: inclined to talk a lot or engage in conversation frequently
examples: My talkative neighbor always has stories to share
The usually talkative child became quiet when strangers arrived

definitions: having a greater than average height or extending high upward
difficult to believe or accept as true; exaggerated or improbable
examples: The tall building dominated the city skyline
He's too tall for the low doorway
That's a tall tale if I ever heard one
She made tall claims about her achievements

definitions: not wild or dangerous; domesticated and accustomed to humans
lacking spirit, interest, or excitement; dull and conventional
examples: The tame rabbits lived happily in the garden
These tame animals won't survive in the wild
The party was pretty tame compared to last year
His tame response disappointed the audience

definitions: brought under control from a wild state; domesticated or subdued
examples: The once wild horse was now completely tamed
Tamed lions performed in the circus show

definitions: of a light yellowish-brown color like leather or sand
having skin darkened by exposure to sun or artificial light
examples: She wore tan leather boots with her outfit
The tan upholstery matched the wooden furniture
His tan skin showed he'd spent summer outdoors
She had a nice tan from her beach vacation

definitions: diverging from the main point or only slightly relevant to the topic
relating to or along a tangent; touching lightly at the edge
examples: His tangential remarks confused the main argument
These tangential issues distract from our primary goal
The tangential force acts perpendicular to the radius
A tangential approach path minimizes collision risk

definitions: of a bright reddish-orange color like the citrus fruit
examples: She painted the sunset in tangerine and pink hues
The tangerine dress stood out at the party

definitions: perceptible by touch; having physical form that can be touched
clear and definite; real and concrete rather than imaginary or vague
examples: The sculpture provided tangible evidence of ancient craftsmanship
Tangible assets include buildings and equipment
We need tangible results before the board meeting
Her excitement was tangible in the room

definitions: twisted together in a confused mass that is hard to separate
complicated and confused; difficult to understand or resolve
examples: Her tangled hair needed careful brushing
The tangled fishing lines took hours to separate
The tangled web of lies finally unraveled
Their tangled relationship caused many problems

definitions: having skin made brown by exposure to sun or artificial light
converted into leather by treating animal hide with tannin or chemicals
examples: His tanned face showed years of outdoor work
She returned from vacation beautifully tanned
The tanned leather was soft and supple
Tanned hides hung in the workshop

definitions: arousing desire or interest while remaining just out of reach or not fully satisfied
examples: The tantalizing aroma of fresh bread filled the bakery
She caught tantalizing glimpses of the ocean through trees

definitions: equivalent in seriousness to; virtually the same as something else
examples: His silence was tantamount to an admission of guilt
This decision is tantamount to surrender

definitions: fastened, secured, or repaired using adhesive tape
recorded on magnetic tape or video for later playback
examples: The taped box was ready for shipping
His taped ankle supported him through the game
The taped interview will air tomorrow night
They reviewed the taped confession carefully

definitions: becoming gradually narrower toward one end; diminishing in thickness
examples: The tapered candle fit perfectly in the holder
Her tapered fingers moved gracefully over the piano keys

definitions: gradually becoming thinner or narrower toward one end
examples: The tapering tower reached high into the sky
A tapering waistline creates an elegant silhouette

definitions: struck or touched lightly with a quick motion
accessed, utilized, or made use of a resource or potential
examples: He tapped his fingers nervously on the table
The tapped maple trees produced sweet syrup
The company tapped new markets for growth
She was tapped for the leadership position

definitions: arriving, happening, or done after the scheduled or expected time
examples: The tardy student missed the morning announcements
Her tardy arrival disrupted the entire meeting

definitions: having a sharp, acidic taste that makes the mouth pucker
sharp or cutting in speech or manner; expressing criticism harshly
examples: The tart green apples made perfect pie filling
This lemonade is too tart without enough sugar
Her tart reply silenced the critics immediately
His tart comments offended several colleagues

definitions: showing good judgment about aesthetic, social, or cultural matters; refined and appropriate
examples: The tasteful decorations enhanced the room's elegance
She wore a tasteful black dress to the funeral

definitions: having little or no flavor; bland or insipid
showing poor judgment in aesthetic or social matters; vulgar or inappropriate
examples: The tasteless hospital food was barely edible
This tasteless soup needs salt and spices
His tasteless jokes offended everyone at dinner
The tasteless decorations ruined the event's atmosphere

definitions: having a pleasant, appealing flavor; delicious or appetizing
examples: The tasty meal satisfied everyone at the table
These tasty snacks disappeared quickly at the party

definitions: old and torn; in poor condition from long use or wear
examples: His tattered coat barely kept him warm
The tattered flag still flew above the fort

definitions: intended to provoke or challenge in a mocking, insulting way
examples: His taunting remarks sparked a heated argument
The crowd's taunting chants upset the visiting team

definitions: stretched or pulled tight; not slack or loose
showing emotional or mental strain; tense and controlled
examples: The taut rope held the heavy load securely
Keep the sail taut for maximum speed
Her face was taut with concentration
The taut atmosphere made everyone uncomfortable

definitions: of an orange-brown or yellowish-brown color like a lion
examples: The lion's tawny mane gleamed in the sunlight
She admired the owl's tawny feathers

definitions: required by law to have tax paid on it; subject to taxation
examples: Most of your income is taxable by federal law
Taxable goods include luxury items and electronics

definitions: requiring significant physical effort or stamina to complete
requiring considerable mental effort, concentration, or emotional energy
examples: The taxing climb left everyone exhausted
Marathon running is taxing on the body
The taxing calculations required complete concentration
Dealing with difficult customers can be emotionally taxing

definitions: of a dark greenish-blue color like the duck's head markings
examples: She painted the bedroom walls a soothing teal
The teal waters of the Caribbean looked inviting

definitions: crying or about to cry; showing sadness through tears
examples: Her tearful goodbye moved everyone at the station
The tearful reunion lasted for several minutes

definitions: pulling apart or into pieces with force
moving at very high speed; rushing violently
examples: The tearing sound meant the fabric had ripped
Tearing paper can be therapeutic for some people
He went tearing down the highway at dangerous speeds
She came tearing around the corner

definitions: subjected to playful or unkind mockery or provocation
having hair styled by combing it backward to create volume
examples: The teased child felt hurt by his classmates
She felt teased about her accent
Her teased hair was typical of 1980s fashion
The teased bangs added height to her hairstyle

definitions: making fun of someone in a playful or sometimes hurtful way
examples: His teasing manner made her laugh despite herself
The teasing comments went too far this time

definitions: involving or requiring specialized knowledge or skills in a particular field
relating to the practical application of machinery or applied sciences
examples: The technical manual explained complex procedures clearly
She encountered technical difficulties with the software
The technical aspects of painting require years of practice
His technical skills impressed the hiring manager

definitions: relating to or involving the use of technology, especially advanced scientific knowledge
examples: Technological advances have transformed modern medicine
The company made significant technological improvements

definitions: relating to the structure and movement of the earth's crust and large-scale processes
examples: Tectonic plates shift constantly beneath the ocean floor
The tectonic forces created massive mountain ranges

definitions: too long, slow, or dull; tiresome because of length or dullness
examples: The tedious lecture seemed to last forever
Filing paperwork is a tedious but necessary task

definitions: full of or swarming with; present in large numbers
examples: The teeming marketplace buzzed with activity
Waters teeming with fish attracted many fishermen

definitions: relating to or characteristic of teenagers aged thirteen to nineteen
examples: The teen drama captured high school life perfectly
Teen fashion trends change rapidly each season

definitions: relating to or characteristic of people aged between thirteen and nineteen
examples: Her teenage daughter started high school this year
Teenage rebellion is a normal developmental phase

definitions: being between thirteen and nineteen years of age
examples: The teenaged boy worked at the local store
Two teenaged girls started the environmental club

definitions: using few words in a brief, direct style like old telegrams
examples: His telegraphic style made emails quick to read
The telegraphic message conveyed only essential information

definitions: relating to or having the supposed ability to communicate thoughts directly between minds
examples: Their telepathic connection seemed almost supernatural
She wished she had telepathic powers
